greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse function for injection A005187.
comment: a(0)=0; thereafter if n occurs as a term of A005187, a(n)=its position in A005187, otherwise zero. This works as an "inverse" function for A005187 in a sense that a(A005187(n)) = n for all n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
formula: a(0)=0, for n>0, a(n) = A079559(n) * (A046699(n+2)-1) [With A046699's October 2012 starting offset. Incorrect indexing shown in this formula corrected by _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 18 2013]
program: (define (A213714 n) (if (< n 1) 0 (* (A079559 n) (- (A046699 (+ n 2)) 1)))) ;; With A046699's October 2012 starting offset.
f (x:xs) ys'@(y:ys) i | x == y    = i : f xs ys (i+1)
def a053644(n): return 0 if n==0 else 2**(len(bin(n)[2:]) - 1)
def a(n): return 0 if n==0 else a079559(n)*(a046699(n + 2) - 1) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 11 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 26 2012
